data.question: What is the purpose of synthesizing phosphoryl-rich flame-retardant ions (FRIONs)?
data.answer: The purpose is to impart flame-retardant properties for their use as potential flame-retardant ions (FRIONs), additives, or replacements for other lithium salts for safer lithium-ion batteries.

data.question: What are the names of the four lithium salts mentioned in the text?
What method was used to fully characterize the new materials?
data.answer: The new materials were fully characterized using single-crystal structures determination and thermogravimetric analysis.

data.question: Is the lithium ion in Li[B(DPC)(oxalato)] tetrahedrally coordinated?
data.answer: Yes, the lithium ion in Li[B(DPC)(oxalato)] is tetrahedrally coordinated.

data.question: What is the yield percentage of Li[B(DPC)2] when synthesized?
Does the synthesis of Li[P(DPC)3] involve the evolution of HCl gas?
data.answer: Yes, the synthesis of Li[P(DPC)3] involves the evolution of HCl gas.

data.question: What is the primary component of lithium-ion batteries (LIBs) mentioned in the text?
data.answer: The primary component of LIBs mentioned is the electrolyte.

data.question: Based on the text, can FRIONs potentially replace conventional lithium salts without loss of LIB capacity?
data.answer: Yes, FRIONs can potentially replace conventional lithium salts without jeopardizing the loss of LIB capacity.

data.question: What is the result of adding flame-retardant compounds to the electrolyte solution?
data.answer: The result is a reduction in the flammability of the electrolyte solution.

data.question: Did FRION 1 have issues with low yields and limited solubility?
data.answer: Yes, FRION 1 suffered from low yields and limited solubility.

data.question: What was the purpose of replacing the two phosphinato groups in FRION 1?
data.answer: The purpose was to enhance the thermal stability of FRIONs.

data.question: What does the thermal gravimetric analysis reveal about the new FRIONs?
data.answer: It reveals that each material is stable up to around 200 8C, with Li[B(DPC)F2] showing additional stability up to 280 8C.

data.question: Are the new FRIONs expected to have reduced flammability based on PCFC results?
data.answer: Yes, the PCFC results show that these new ions have reduced flammability.

data.question: What does the presence of the two O = P(OMe)2 units do to the energy of the HOMO orbital?
data.answer: It drives the energy of the HOMO orbital down by 0.83 eV.

data.question: Is LiBOB considered the least flammable material tested based on the data?
data.answer: Yes, LiBOB is considered the least flammable material tested based on the data.

data.question: What is the effect of higher char yields on total heat release?
data.answer: Higher char yields are responsible for lower total heat release as more of the structure is bound up as char.

data.question: Does the utility of anions in LIBs depend on their stability under a range of oxidation potentials?
data.answer: Yes, the utility of anions in LIBs depends on their stability under a range of oxidation potentials.

data.question: What computational method was used to predict the oxidative stability of catechol borate anions?
data.answer: The computational method used was DFT B3LYP 6-311 ++ G(2df,2p) for structure minimization and HF 6-311 ++ G(3df,3dp) for a single point calculation.

data.question: What is the yield percentage of Li[P(DPC)3] when synthesized?
Are electrochemical measurements underway to examine the behavior and performance of the new FRIONs in LIBs?
data.answer: Yes, electrochemical measurements are now underway to examine the behavior and performance of the new FRIONs in LIBs.
